content.content: On the surface, Gleipnir is a multinational corporation that specialises in the design and production of
consumer and military products. The consumer

, Gleipir produces military vehicles and soldier drones. Beneath the surface, however, Gleipnir serves a more sinister purpose. With the production of military drones, Gleipnir is equipping itself for war, with the eventual goal of taking over the world.
Gleipnir’s various products are created by transforming subjects (mostly unwilling people) into objects through a versatile chemical, nicknamed “
”. This Goo is sourced from the
, a colossal beast living in the center of the Earth. The centre of these operations is the
The list of people with connections to Gleipnir can be found
The Gleipnir complex is the centre of Gleipnir’s operations. Located in the middle of
) of land space. The Gleipnir complex consists of the following buildings:
Velas is a city with a population of 1.3 million.

is situated in the heart of the city where the business centre is located. While the government is aware of Gleipnir’s illegal operations, corrupt officials turn a blind eye to them. The government has benefited from working with Gleipnir, boosting their economy, using them to get rid of political prisoners, and offering them free drones. In return, Gleipnir has influence over their political decisions.
Located in the heart of the Gleipnir complex, the Headquarters function as the administrative centre of all of Gleipnir’s operations. There are two areas of the building: the main office and the

The main office is located above the ground. This is where the central business planning takes place. While most of the floors are occupied by offices, there are recreational amenities such as an art gallery, lounges, and a spa. The facilities are also managed by Gleipnir drones, furniture, and appliances. The radio tower is mounted at the top of Gleipnir Headquarters. The office area holds about 30,000 employees.
The Underground is located below the depth of
, and is accessible only via the elevators in the Headqaurters.
The Underground refers to the secret facilities located beneath
. These facilities are only accessible by
employees. Due to the secretive nature of the Underground, even Class A employees may not be privy to all the workings there. The Underground is divided into 3 different sectors:
Located 150m (492 ft) below ground level, the Factory functions as the source of all

is pumped from storage tanks to convert subjects into various products. Other production facilities are: padded rooms for storage of subjects, training rooms for slaves and drones, a mind control facility, a storage sector, and the incinerator. There is also a research laboratory where advancements in Goo technology are made.

Located 260m (853 ft) below ground level, the Prison holds subjects (pre-processed and post-processed) for long durations of time, from anywhere between a week to years. At the lowest floor of the Prison is the Hatch: a repurposed air duct that leads to
. The Hatch is where employees deposit residual
from production, as well as the converted results of lab experiments.
Located 740m (2428 ft) below ground level, The Abandoned Place (shortened to “Abandoned”) is sealed off from the rest of the
. It used to be a research laboratory to study the
There are 4 towers located in the centre of the
. These consist of offices to facilitate the business operations of Gleipnir such as sales, marketing, and distribution of its
. Each tower has a capacity of 5000 to 10,000, depending on the building size. These buildings are only accessible by
There are three types of housing buildings within the
: employee apartments, luxury suites, and public apartments.

only. By keeping the apartments close to the Gleipnir Headquarters and Towers, employees can save time on their commute, ensuring efficient use of their time. The apartment area can fit up to 20,000 employees, although some employees opt to live in other residences for personal reasons such as family and facility access.
The luxury suites are reserved for the wealthy and powerful citizens of

. Equipped with various amenities such as a shopping district, high-class restaurants, and a nature park, the luxury suites attract people who have a finer taste in life with the pockets to afford it. The residents tend to hire Gleipnir drones for personal use. Publicly, they act as butlers and guards. However, within their master’s homes, some may be forced to serve the twisted pleasures and desires of their masters.
Public apartments are occupied by citizens of Velas. Drones would be a rare sight here, as the majority of the residents here cannot afford such luxuries.
Office buildings surround the main Gleipnir complex. Many small civilian businesses are located here, allowing their offices to be situated close to the public housing buildings.

The slums are the result of a high-density housing project initiated by a now-bankrupt construction company. The project was abandoned due to financial reasons, and the incomplete building structure remains. Squatters have since moved in, most of them earning a living through use of illegally-obtained drones. They put the drones to use as errand drones, making them carry out grunt work or illegal activities.
There are 6 military buildings surrounding the Gleipnir Headquarters building. These store, equip, and train military drones.
Due to shortage of parking spaces in Velas, Gleipnir offers free parking in their parking complex. The building is 3 storeys high, taking up 600,000m
) of land area to support its capacity of 100,000 cars.

While not technically a building, Level Zero (shortened to Zero) is a notable sector of the Gleipnir complex. It is an underground section that spans almost the entire complex. It is located 70m (230 ft) below the ground, spanning almost the entire land space of the Gleipnir complex. The underground space is 20m (66 ft) from floor to ceiling, although this may differ due to events like cave-ins of the concrete ceiling, or destructive work done on the concrete flooring by the inhabitants of Zero.

Initially dug out by Gleipnir for the intention of building more facilities, the area was deemed too shallow for their secret operations. A concrete floor and ceiling were constructed before the project was eventually abandoned. Since then, people have moved into Level Zero, turning it into a bustling black market. Within the 20m (66 ft) of vertical space, people have built 1-3 storey apartments and shophouses. An estimated population of 5000 people inhabit Zero, although the visitor count adds about 10,000 people to its numbers.
throughout the surface allow its population to enter and leave.
Gleipnir has made no effort to clear the area

Zero can be entered and exited through many points on the surface such as manhole openings, the sewer system, and the Slums. While Zero overlaps with the Gleipnir Headquarters’ underground sector, security barriers prevent the public from entering the building’s interior.

While Gleipnir is aware of Zero, it has not made any attempts to evict its unlawful tenants. In fact, it capitalises on the space, setting up an underground market there. Gleipnir has shops selling sex drones which are unsuitable for public markets. Many of these drones can be publicly tested for free. Tourists, cartels, and gangsters within Zero also bring in business for their products.

Gleipnir complex is restricted by clearance levels. Gleipnir employees are assigned a class, allowing them to access facilities at that level and below. There are 3 employee classes: Class A, B, C, with A being the highest, and Z being the lowest.
The public has access to all areas of the Gleipnir complex EXCEPT for the
Class C employees are security staff, maintainence staff, or contractors. In addition to what the public can access, they can access the
(depending on their job assignment). The estimated count of
Class B employees are office workers of Gleipnir that make up the Sales, Marketing, and Engineering department. In addition to what
employees can access, they have access to the office sector of

. Maintainence workers with appropriate security clearance may also be granted this class in order to perform maintainence within Gleipnir Headquarters. The estimated count of Class B employees is 45,000.
Class A employees have access to all Gleipnir facilities, including the

. Due to the secretive nature of the work done in the Underground, much of the work done is automated, leaving very little manpower required to manage its processes. As such, the estimated count of Class A employees is only 50, and their identities are kept secret. They carry an access pass that looks like a
pass in order to disguise their true position, while giving them access to the Underground.
While not technically an employee class, this unofficial classification is given to personnel who have been converted into

While on the surface, Gleipnir’s products seem to be either inanimate objects, or people dressed in drone suits, the reality is much darker. Made from mostly unwilling subjects, these subjects are subjected to treatment by a chemical nicknamed “Goo”. Based on the chemical composition of the Goo, the result can range from temporarily coating a body part in the latex-like material, all the way to turning the subject’s body into a malleable material that can be moulded and shaped into the physical product. In most cases, the subject’s consciousness is still intact. From there, hypnosis or other brainwashing techniques can be used to shape the subject’s consciousness for the product’s purposes. For instance, a sex drone would need to have its identity stripped, and its sexual hunger would need to be increased. On the other hand, living liquid dispensers only need to control the flow of liquid through its body.
Gleipnir’s Products are categorised into the following types:
: Hypnosis visor, Dronification, Normal gasmask for public
: Drone XXXX(Number 0001~9999), Most common drone type, Visor, Anal or Mouth hole(Optional), Mitten, Program words = Obedience, Slave,
: Feral drones, D-ring or amputated, Robot limbs attached
: Anal, Dick and mouth connected to fleshlight or plate using portal ring. There’s some customized fleshligt and dido. such as ear hole, urethra, horn and limbs
: Anal, Dick and mouth connected to fleshlight or plate using portal ring. There’s some customized fleshligt and dido. such as ear hole, urethra, horn and limbs

: It's a customized chastity cage. It has features of the original subject. Gleipnir’s chastity cage is alive. It’s normal if they squeeze or flinch. Some chastity cage have countdown and vibration functions.
: Drones or subject’s head turning into plug, tail remain. You can customize plug desgin, such as tail, head and face.
: Pool toy for fun. Living rubber creatures.
Within the Gleipnir complex, there are 6 military buildings. These military buildings control the training and storage of military equipment such:
Military vehicles such as jeeps, tanks, and artillery

These facilities are hidden from public eye with the exception of the soldier drones which act as security personnel. Their armour conceals their bodies and faces, allowing them to be mistaken for non-drone personnel. Should the Gleipnir complex be threatened by any physical force, these forces will be the first line of defence.

Gleipnir also has military forces outside of the Gleipnir complex, where vocations such as army intelligence, air defence, aircrafts, military ships, and so on are produced, trained, and stored in secret. These will be activated should the Gleipnir Headquarters be physically threatened, and the first line of defence is insufficient.
High mucocity, density and adhesive material. It can be easily moddable, ductile and malleable. Goo is used to make
Project Qundium is an experiment led by Master Orca. Gleipnir’s supply of Goo is controlled by the Leviathan, which
The purpose of the experiment was to

[??? purpose? Origins?] Gleipnir didn’t want to rely on leviathan. They reuse the goo waste to create more. He tried to make him a slave one day he used rubbershark to create only goo. However, the experiment failed due to the use of goo waste, and rubbershark began to absorb entirely degraded goo waste. And when rubbershark's subconscious (mostly evil) returned, qundium was created.
The following is a non-exhaustive list of various characters related to Gleipnir.
was a shark-cat hybrid made of white goo. His signature outfit is a blue and white tropical-print shirt, and a red collar with a golden bell.
However, after being captured by Gleipnir employees
, he was the subject of their various experiments. One of the experiments turned him into a Goo creature called
Rubbershark : Drone type is a licking drone. It’s Rubberized cocoshark. Made of 100% Gleipnir rubber.
Qundium : Rubber dragon shark living in an abandoned place.
Master orca : Eyeless orca. He use supersound
The Leviathan is a colossal snake-like beast living in the centre of the Earth. Its biological makeup consists almost entirely of a chemical that Gleipnir calls “
”. All Goo from Gleipnir is sourced from the Leviathan, and pumped up to the underground Factory where Gleipnir makes its

The Leviathan provides Gleipnir with “fresh Goo”: Goo with active properties, allowing it to bind to biological tissue and turning it into malleable material for Gleipnir to create products. In return, Gleipnir allows “waste Goo” to return to the Leviathan. Waste Goo is the byproduct of Gleipnir’s Goo-processing. After tissue conversion, the residual Goo is saturated with biological waste. However, these biological compounds function as “life essence” to the Leviathan, and hence it benefits from this symbiotic relationship with Gleipnir.
Knowledge of the Leviathan is restricted to very few key personnel within Gleipnir. Most Class A employees are not aware of the Leviathan.
The origins and motives of the Leviathan is unknown.
